cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Key West and the Dry Tortugas; Florida Bay; portions of the central Bahamas and much of Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for parts of the Dominican Republic, Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, and eastern Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Florida Keys, South Florida coastal waters, then the northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana eastward to Mississippi–Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands could bring isolated tropical-storm-force gusts (≤39 mph) to the Miami area Monday; sustained gale conditions remain unlikely (<6% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding or elevated tides possible along Biscayne Bay, but surge >3 ft is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible Monday into early Tuesday as outer bands pass south of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches beginning late Sunday and Monday.
